etymology.interpretation: Mouth signals an action of expelling from the mouth or an orifice. 賁 provides the sound, aligning with pēn and guiding the sense of spouting or spraying outward.
etymology.simplification: 賁 was simplified to 贲, reducing strokes while preserving the 口 + phonetic structure and pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 他往花园里喷水(他往花園裡噴水)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wǎng huāyuán lǐ pēn shuǐ.
examples.english: He sprays water into the garden.

examples.chinese: 我买了一个喷雾器(我買了一個噴霧器)。
火山突然喷发(火山突然噴發)。
